thread.title: Alleged Moto Z (2017) spotted on Geekbench with Qualcomm Snapdragon 835
thread.title_full: Alleged Moto Z (2017) spotted on Geekbench with Qualcomm Snapdragon 835

title: Alleged Moto Z (2017) spotted on Geekbench with Qualcomm Snapdragon 835
text:
Alleged Moto Z (2017) spotted on Geekbench with Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 Alleged Moto Z (2017) spotted on Geekbench with Qualcomm Snapdragon 835   Moto Z’s 2017 variant will offer 4GB of RAM and Android Nougat” 
Lenovo unveiled the Moto Z and Moto Z Play ( review ) as its first modular smartphones last year, and the devices went on sale in India in October. Now it appears that the company is working on the successor to the Moto Z ( review ) . The alleged Moto Z (2017) has been spotted on the Geekbench benchmarking website, revealing a couple of its specs. 
The Moto Z (2017) has been spotted on the benchmarking website with the model number Motorola XT1650. The phone appears to be powered by top-of-the-line 1.9GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 processor, mated to 4GB of RAM. The listing also reveals that the device will be running Android 7.1.1 Nougat out of the box. 
Unfortunately, the listing hasn’t revealed anything else about the 2017 variant of the Moto Z. The Snapdragon 835 will certainly be a huge upgrade over the Snapdragon 820, which powers the current-gen Moto Z. We will update you as soon as anything new pops up on the interwebs regarding the new Moto Z, so watch this space.
